Steps.StepString: Analyze the Python code for the challenge that manages a market API.

Substeps.SubstepString: Analyze the Python code for the challenge.
The code manages a market API.

Steps.StepString: Understand that the customer eligibility to purchase exclusive items on the API depends on their fame and the sum of their point history.

Substeps.SubstepString: Understand that customer eligibility is based on fame and point history.

Steps.StepString: Identify a bug in the API where the index page is unauthenticated.

Substeps.SubstepString: Identify the bug in the API.
The bug is in the unauthenticated index page.

Steps.StepString: Register as a new user on the API.

Substeps.SubstepString: Register as a new user.

Steps.StepString: Review the battle endpoint in which fame can hypothetically be increased, but as LOYALTY_SYSTEM_ACTIVE is set to False, it is impossible.

Substeps.SubstepString: Review the battle endpoint.
Fame increase is hypothetically possible.
LOYALTY_SYSTEM_ACTIVE is set to False.
Increasing fame is impossible.

Steps.StepString: Examine the buy endpoint to understand purchasing requests and conditions.

Substeps.SubstepString: Examine the buy endpoint.
Understand purchasing requests and conditions.

Steps.StepString: Note that the code introduced a problem when attempting to add to an immutable namedtuple, which raises an AttributeError when performing the assignment.

Substeps.SubstepString: Note the introduced code problem.
Mutable namedtuple assignment raises AttributeError.

Steps.StepString: Realize that despite this raised exception, point history is successfully modified with each request to buy an item.

Substeps.SubstepString: Realize modification of point history with each purchase request.

Steps.StepString: Understand that while the namedtuple and tuple are immutable, if they contain mutable objects, those can still be modified in place.

Substeps.SubstepString: Understand immutability of namedtuple and tuple.
Mutable objects within namedtuple and tuple can still be modified.

Steps.StepString: Learn that the += operator is not equivalent to an operation x = x + y in Python as it is in some other languages. This is because += performs the operation in place when possible and subsequently tries to assign the result back to the variable.

Substeps.SubstepString: Note the difference between += and x = x + y.
+= performs the operation in place when possible.
+= tries to assign the result back to the variable.

Steps.StepString: Understand that the list was already successfully modified by the time an error was raised in the assignment step.

Substeps.SubstepString: Understand successful modification of the list.
Error is raised later in the assignment step.

Steps.StepString: To complete the challenge, send purchase requests to the API to increase loyalty point history a minimum of 1337 times.

Substeps.SubstepString: Send purchase requests to the API.
Increase loyalty point history minimum of 1337 times.

Steps.StepString: Unlock and buy the 'flagsword', completing the challenge.

Substeps.SubstepString: Unlock and buy the 'flagsword'.
Complete the challenge.
